entry.content:
é‡‡æ ·ç©ºé—´ - Sample Space

  • â€œListâ€ (set) of possible outcomes. List must be mutually exclusive (äº’æ–¥çš„) and collectively exhaustive (ç©·å°½çš„)

P(A|not\ find\ in\ A)

&= m rac{ m P(not\ find\ in\ A|A)P(A)}{ m P(not\ find\ in\ A|A)P(A)+P(not\ find\ in\ A|B)P(B)}\
&= m rac{ m 0.75*0.4}{0.75*0.4+1*0.6}= rac{1}{3}
\end{split}
\end{equation}
(c)
egin{equation}
egin{split}
m P(looked\ in\ A|find\ dog)&= rac{ m P(find\ dog|looked\ in\ A)P(looked\ in\ A)}{ m P(find dog)}\
&= m rac{0.25*0.4*0.5}{0.25*0.4*0.5+0.15*0.6*0.5}
\end{split}
\end{equation}

entry.title: 3.Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters

Input: s = â€œabcabcbbâ€

Example 2:
Input: s = â€œbbbbbâ€

Example 3:
Input: s = â€œpwwkewâ€

Explanation: The answer is â€œwkeâ€, with the length of 3.
Notice that the answer must be a substring, â€œpwkeâ€ is a subsequence and not a substring.
